posts.post_content:
@ Gaussgoat:  
  
Says in the rulings that it's not prevention, so it works even on damage that can't be prevented. Which is quite good.

Posted By: lukemol (9/13/2010 6:18:05 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
Says "prevent" right on the card. Why would that be Oracle-updated away? Plenty of red cards care about the difference.  
Easy to template the right way: "The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent half of that damage, rounded down."  
Of course, this would make the card even less useful, but it's a matter of principle.
posts.html:
Says "prevent" right on the card. Why would that be Oracle-updated away? Plenty of red cards care about the difference.
Easy to template the right way: "The next time a source of your choice would deal damage to you this turn, prevent half of that damage, rounded down."
Of course, this would make the card even less useful, but it's a matter of principle.

Posted By: johnhock (12/23/2009 8:11:23 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
*"Actually quite good in non-white EDH if your in a meta where Big-One-Shot-General-Hits are making your life miserable. Overall a pretty good 0 drop artifact too (just not better than the creatures, moxes, X spells or the baubles)."*   
   
Any spot removal would be better (or a [Fog](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Fog) effect, which would at least stop all of the damage). With the sphere, you don't actually solve the problem; the general is still alive and will just kill you next turn. It's doubtful the opponent will have left himself open to a counter-attack, either, as he will have known going into the turn that you had the Sphere waiting. For this reason, he also won't have gone all-in with a card like [Hatred](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Hatred) or [Berserk](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Berserk).
posts.html:
"Actually quite good in non-white EDH if your in a meta where Big-One-Shot-General-Hits are making your life miserable. Overall a pretty good 0 drop artifact too (just not better than the creatures, moxes, X spells or the baubles)."

Any spot removal would be better (or a Fog effect, which would at least stop all of the damage). With the sphere, you don't actually solve the problem; the general is still alive and will just kill you next turn. It's doubtful the opponent will have left himself open to a counter-attack, either, as he will have known going into the turn that you had the Sphere waiting. For this reason, he also won't have gone all-in with a card like Hatred or Berserk.

Posted By: scumbling1 (5/18/2011 5:42:53 PM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Wow, this is exactly what you should be able to get for 0 mana (plus a card). Actually just outright preventing the damage might have been alright; Fog, after all, prevents all damage from multiple sources for a single mana. But still, this card is kind of elegant, I like.
posts.html:
Wow, this is exactly what you should be able to get for 0 mana (plus a card). Actually just outright preventing the damage might have been alright; Fog, after all, prevents all damage from multiple sources for a single mana. But still, this card is kind of elegant, I like.

Posted By: Gabriel422 (12/4/2010 8:25:58 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content:
An interesting insurance policy, although there are two major issues with it:
  
   
1) Tons of "game killing hits" are now life-loss vs damage.
  
   
2) A lot of high-damage strikes from the likes of red can't be redirected. (ie [Lava Burst](/Pages/Card/Details.aspx?name=Lava Burst) )
  
   
There are definitely worse artifacts you could have though, and it is hard to argue with the casting cost.
  
   
2.5/5
posts.html:
An interesting insurance policy, although there are two major issues with it:

1) Tons of "game killing hits" are now life-loss vs damage.

2) A lot of high-damage strikes from the likes of red can't be redirected. (ie Lava Burst )

There are definitely worse artifacts you could have though, and it is hard to argue with the casting cost.

2.5/5

Posted By: Gaussgoat (1/6/2010 5:27:31 AM)
Rating:

posts.post_content: Actually quite good in non-white EDH if your in a meta where Big-One-Shot-General-Hits are making your life miserable. Overall a pretty good 0 drop artifact too (just not better than the creatures, moxes, X spells or the baubles). Seems to have been made to stop stuff like Channel + Fireball and does that pretty well too.
